result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan nmi Garibay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 88 days, if revoked.
No restitution requested.
Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court every Wed at 3:30pm.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with co deft or WalMart Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft accepted into Drug Court and to report to Drug Court every Wednesday at 3:30pm.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.

May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Drug Court Agreement
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant Juan nmi Garibay appeared with Attorney Lara Parker.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: JM.
MINUTES:  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Poss of Narcotic Drugs, 2nd & Subsequent Offense, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Cts 2, 3 & 4 were dismissed and read-in on State's motion.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report waived.
Ct 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 36 months w/conditions.  88 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Appeal rights given.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court every Wed. at 3:30pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lara Parker.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parkers states DE has been accepted into drug court so cases will be resolved through drug court on 4/1/15 at 3:30 PM.
Plea & Sentencing hrg set for 4/1/15 at 3:30 pm before Drug Court at the request of Atty Parker & ADA Braun.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Lara Parker. Clerk LE. Case trails 15CF16 at prelim today. Judicial pretrial on 3-13-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
Lara Parker
for Substitution of Counsel filed by Atty Edwards
Court has reviewed and approves Atty Edward's request since no objection by the State.

Email correspondence received from Atty Edwards stating there is a stipulation for substitution of attorneys and Atty Parker is unavailable on 1/21/15. Atty Edwards requests the hearing on 1/21/15 be canceled and held over with the newer file that is set for a prelim on 1/23/15.

Defendant, Juan nmi Garibay, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:40 am.
